FuncDef:
The flow-wred command binds a drop policy profile to a queue priority sub-view of a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
The undo flow-wred command unbinds a drop policy profile from a queue priority sub-view of a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
By default, no drop policy profile is configured in a flow queue profile.

ParaDef.Info:
Specify flow-wred template name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
A flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode is used to configure scheduling parameters for eight priority queues. You can configure a scheduling priority, weight, CIR, PIR, and drop policy for the eight queues, scheduling service traffic with different priorities. To configure a drop policy in a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode, run the flow-wred command.
Prerequisites
A drop policy profile has been created.
Precautions
Only LPUI-52/LPUF-53/LPUI-242/LPUF-243/LPUI-242-CM/LPUI-242-G/LPUI-402/LPUI-402-CM/LPUF-483/LPUI-2T-L/LPUI-2T-CM/LPUF-1T2 boards support a flow queue profile in enhanced 8-CoS mode.
